newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch cable firm Casema signs credit facility.
newsitem.headline: Dutch cable firm Casema signs credit facility.

text.p: Dutch banks ABN AMRO and ING Barings said on Thursday a consortium led by them had agreed a 450 million guilder bridge finance facility with cable television operator Casema NV, owned by KPN.

They said the finance would allow Casema to continue funding its planned acquisition of The Hague cable network and improve and expand its networks to take advantage of the new telephony market as well as a wide range of multi-media activities.
Casema, with 1.2 million subscribers, is the largest cable firm in the Netherlands and one of the biggest in Europe. It is fully owned by Vision Networks, in turn part of Dutch PTT (KPN).
